section.title: Minor Versioning
section.t: NFSv4.2 is a minor version of NFSv4 and is built upon NFSv4.1 as documented in and .
NFSv4.2 does not modify the rules applicable to the NFSv4 versioning process and follows the rules set out in or in standard-track documents updating that document (e.g., in an RFC based on ).

NFSv4.2 only defines extensions to NFSv4.1, each of which may be supported (or not) independently. It does not
introduce infrastructural features
make existing features MANDATORY to NOT implement
change the status of existing features (i.e., by changing their status among OPTIONAL, RECOMMENDED, REQUIRED).

The following versioning-related considerations should be noted.
When a new case is added to an existing switch, servers need to report non-support of that new case by returning NFS4ERR_UNION_NOTSUPP.
As regards the potential cross-minor-version transfer of stateids, Parallel NFS (pNFS) (see Section 12 of ) implementations of the file mapping type may support of use of an NFSv4.2 metadata sever (see Sections 1.7.2.2 and 12.2.2 of ) with NFSv4.1 data servers. In this context, a stateid returned by an NFSv4.2 COMPOUND will be used in an NFSv4.1 COMPOUND directed to the data server (see Sections
and ).
